title: Lakshmibai Dravid and the Birth of the Hindu Right
abstractText: This book is a critical edition and translation of a path-breaking Marathi source titled 'Essays in the service of the Nation', (1896) by an Indian woman, Lakshmibai Dravid. The tract is unique because it is the first critique of imperialism by a woman nationalist and also an early expression of Hindu fundamentalism in modern Indian history. An invaluable source for understanding Indian politics, culture and society during the Raj, it will provide fresh insights in to the rise of the Hindu Right in India and will also interest present-day readers keen on understanding the genesis and consolidation of fundamentalist ideologies.
